name: Cursor-Specific Features
description: Rules for leveraging Cursor IDE's unique features, including keyboard shortcuts, AI assistance, and collaboration

rules.name: Keyboard Shortcuts
rules.description: Essential Cursor keyboard shortcuts to use
guidelines: Use `Cmd+Shift+P` (Mac) / `Ctrl+Shift+P` (Windows/Linux) for command palette
Use `Cmd+K` (Mac) / `Ctrl+K` (Windows/Linux) for quick file navigation
Use `F1` to show AI chat panel
Use `Cmd+I` (Mac) / `Ctrl+I` (Windows/Linux) for inline AI completion
Document custom shortcuts in project README

rules.name: AI-Assisted Development
rules.description: Best practices for using Cursor's AI features
guidelines: Use AI for generating boilerplate code
Verify and validate all AI-generated code
Use AI to explain complex code sections
Share effective prompts with team members
Always review AI-generated code for correctness

rules.name: Collaborative Coding
rules.description: Standards for collaborative development in Cursor
guidelines: Use Cursor's collaborative editing for pair programming
Set clear goals for collaborative sessions
Use Cursor's collaborative features for real-time code reviews
Document decisions made during collaborative sessions
Share AI insights during review sessions

rules.name: IDE Settings
guidelines: Use consistent formatting settings across the team
Configure linters and formatters to run on save
Set up project-specific snippets for common patterns
Install required extensions: ESLint, Prettier, Python, Django
Document extension configuration in project README
